subject: p12433421
History: Alcohol abuse. Sepsis. Upper GI bleed. Suspect continuing infection.
Impression: AP chest compared to : Mild interstitial pulmonary edema has worsened, moderate left pleural effusion has increased. No focal pulmonary abnormalities. Heart size is normal. ET tube and left internal jugular line are in standard placements. Nasogastric tube ends in the upper stomach. Esophageal manometer or temperature probe in place at the level of the carina. No pneumothorax.
